metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20460 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In radare2 prior to 3.1.2, the parseOperands function inlibr/asm/arch/arm/armass64.c allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service(application crash caused by stack-based buffer overflow) by crafting aninput file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-3.2 - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
libradare2-common - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
radare2 - 3.1.2+dfsg-1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: radare2 package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2+dfsg-1.1').
